element_texts.text:
postcard
stamp 5c
postmark STRASBURG, VA 22657  MAY 14 1970 PM

Jack Conroy, Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

postcard image of mailbox, trees, mountain, cloud
Jack I: In Shenandoah Valley for a few days on cattle farm, for
further "recuperation". Doctors say I should move around from
place to place, help get my sea legs back and change of place
supposed to make city life more bearable. Thanks for Chicago
paper. Saw review you did of children's life of W.E. Du Bois -
Had letter from Judy Rayford -    Best,    Jack II.

Tuesday 26, '70
Jack o Boy:

 Back from the hinterlands where I merely walked, ate farm cooking and drank Spring water,

and an artist-friend drove me around the country and thru parts of George Washington National
Forest. Am still recuperating, but have to go back to NH for brief checkup tomorrow. Navy friend
is going to drive me to clinic; unlike Jay du Von, so far as I know he is not a stool pigeon or ultra
conservative - his wife is a friend of mine from Depression Years and her first husband was ex-Nazi
artist who painted Jackie Kennedy's portrait and made a big splash in USA and then suddenly went
back to Austria, actually, I think he just couldnt put up with the Jews and British in USA! His name
is Franz Bueb, and he did some covers for TOWN and Country mag, also restaurant murals. Needless
to say Washington society loved him, as they did everything Nazi during WWII, in their quiet fashion.
Am broke and not much to live on - in debt and behind in taxes - strange people are checking my taxes
& debts - WHO? No one seems to know or will tell. They tried to keep [me] from earning a living
because I was a radical, so called, during the 1930's, and  now that I barely came thru a heart operation
they still hound me. The young people are so right - it is hard to trust adults today, and Nixon and
Spiro are just about as fascistic as you c an get without wearing a Swastika and Brown uniform.
Hope life is better with you.   Best,  Jack II.
on side  Judy sends me Ala. weekly he writes for - same old Judy! Big commissions in the future
he says - At least he can live on $25 00 a week on the bayou. Live high, I imagine.

postcard
stamp 5c
postmark  Northern Virginia 26 JUL 1970  PM

Jack Conroy, Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

postcard image of man with hatchet

Letter from Judy - still on trail of Paul Bunyan and Blue Ox Babe - in Oregon -

where it seems Bunyan has returned. I am afraid few in Eastern USA care or
know about P. Bunyan. I wish I could live in past the way Judy can - I don't
believe he has ever left the 19th century - what news in Missouri? No word
from D.A. Brown - vacation I guess.      Jack II.

postcard
stamp 5c
postmark ALEXANDRIA VA AUG 6 1970  PM
JACK CONROY, Esq.
Conroy's Folly
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri

Philip Love, syndicated columnist (LOVE ON LIFE) of Washington is promoting 
The Society for the Propagation of Pokeweed - pokeweed to be our national edible
weed. Don't you want to be a charter member? Yesterday I thought of a good motto
for SFTPOP, Phil was delighted - it is "A POT OF POKE IS BETTER FOR YOU
THAN A POKE OF POT." Dee Brown says he also heard from Paul Bunyan Judy -
in Oregon. Who is PAUL BUNYAN? You don't have to answer that one.     Jack II.
on side  Letter from Ackerson.

postcard
stamp 5c
An air-view of the city of Charlottesville, Virginia
showing skyline Drive Mountain in the background.
Photo by Ed Roseberry
on side

Jack I :

Recuperating at my brother's. Had open heart surgery -
2 1/2 months at National Institutes of Health - they saved
my life, but for what I don't know? Had to retire from job
on disability, Now the metrics say I may go back to work
in about 6 months!? Who hires citizens over 60? Peace
Corps? Go to moon?     Jack II.
Mr. & Mrs. Jack Conroy
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270
[[in pencil [1970?]

July the Fit-to-be-tied

Jack I, et al:
 Sending my latest - I had two fine drawings the editor had marked for use and engraving dept lost 'em -

found too late for printing in sat. edition on Editorial page, if that helps. Editor sent my drawings back
and I sent them with article to Virginia paper, but doubt if they reprint it - even tho it is about the Blue
Ridge & Ragged Mts - them small independent papers got no use for Yankee papers in Washington. Judy
may reprint it the Ala.-bayou weekly - they used a cartoon of mine the other week, one of Judy in a
haunted graveyard.

 Hope your kidney trouble is mending or whatever - I have to get my poor overworked & undernourished

blood checked next week, but don't have to visit heart clinic until November! Have to see local doctor tho -
about  once a month - he never tells me anything, except I'm doing all right and to lose some ore weight -
my heart can't stand extra weight he says - Guess you been reading about lucky Dee Brown and his vest
seller - he says now he can retire a year earlier - to Arkansas I think - Fayetteville? He's been "barnstorming"
in southwest - now make your Memoirs of the lean 1930s into a best seller. You can do it.  Best wishes and
a mess o'poke greens.     JCR/.  7/5/71.

postcard
stamp 6c
postmark ALEXANDRIA VA JUL 21 1971 AM

Jack Conroy Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

postcard 
postmark ALEXANDRIA VA JUL 23 1971 AM
drawing of outhouse, fence, letter R.  

 Conroy was here
 We know he was here,
 but where did he go? aint seed hide nor har' of him
    JCR/. *

* John C. Rogers was an illustrator

postcard
stamp 6c
postmark AUG 1971 the rest not readable

Jack Conroy, Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

Forgot to tell you - H.J. Lindenschmidt - 5778 Linden St. Rialto, California 92376 - often asks about you - 
he wrote a poem that once caused a hassle with the P.O. Dept. Hank has ailments but barely manages to get by
on Social Security, has a wife, garden and a dog. Sells World Book & Childcraft to eke out a living. JCR/.

Jack I:
Don't have any money to contribute to your Catlick [sic] friends in the Asiatic swamps. Need all I have pay bills. I heard the Catholic
church is wealthy anyhoo, why do they need contributions?

Your sex literature was of no help to me. Was looking at all my scars last night and am surprised with all the cutting they did I wasn't

changed into a female.

 Don't rightly know about Spiro and the Washington Post - the POST tried to get me to subscribe today but I passed it by. For three

weeks I haven't seen a Sunday paper and you know - I haven't missed them. As to being liberal, I suppose you might call the POST a
peculiar kind of liberal paper, but not as liberal as St Louis Post dispatch.

St. Pat's day, 1972
Jack I,

 Yes, the JDL* is an obvious Jewish fascist group - and their storm troopers seen to be able

to flourish with little or no interference from the Law - as you can see, in enclosed clippings.
The JDL is supported, at least partly,  by so called "respectable" citizens and professional
Jews, such as Dr. Wm R. Perl who heads the JDL of "greater Washington" - so many Jews
seem to be turning fascist or conservative - like a friend, Dr. Benjamin Ginzberg - I think
it is GINZBURG, formerly of the WPA Writers Project - he now writes awful conservative
letters to the press, why? I wrote several strong letters to the press against the JDL but the
press saw fit to ignore them, except a Va. paper that doesnt depend on Jew advertising to
survive - I think it was Toynbee who wrote that there was no excuse for the State of Israel -
I suppose All ethnic groups would like a little corner in the world to crawl into, but there
just isn't room - the Irish, the English, the Indians, the Russians, Germans, Czechs, et cetera,
et al - I asked newspaper editor what gives with the Special Police I see in the D.C. Public
Parks - he said they may be from the special diplomatic Embassy Police, and hadn't I noticed
that we were becoming a POLICE STATE? You and Dee Brown can escape to the Ozarks -
hope I can make it to the Blue Ridge - Reading "UPTOWN" - about poor whites in Chicago -
refugees from W.Va, Tenn, and Appalachia - Studs Terkel praises the book - written by a
NEW LEFT writer - 1969 - Ben Botkin's brother has an art exhibit in NYC - Henry Botkin -
I met him once -     (over)
on side "UPTOWN" is by Todd Gitlin and Nanci Hollander (photographer) - better than
Studs Terkel
* Jewish Defense league

Remember Joe Kalar vaguely from New Masses, anvil, and so forth - read a novel by Ben Field I found in library -

about Jewish farmers in upstate New York - I suppose Mike Gold has passed on, don't hear about him - and whatever
became of old Paul Robeson? Brendan Behan classed Robeson as "a great American" which he was - and still is, I hope -
was re-reading biography of "Nicholas II" and how the Czar supported & encouraged rabble-rousing priests to mislead
the masses and foment riots - you think our governmint [sic] is behind Jesus Freaks, Or, Rasputin Billy Graham, Oral
Roberts and such? I think it is a good chance these religious freaks get financial backing from other than their street
corner & rally collections. Keep Americans stoopid! [sic]

 Happy post- St. Patrick's day - and soon be time to pick poke sallit [sic] greens.
 My daughter getting married this summer in the hills of West Virginny - to a nice W. Va. fellow - his folks still live

back in W. Va., altho [sic] his mother lives in Alexandria - they plan an outdoor-picnic wedding in the park - or
forest -    Your Presidential ticket no worse than the real one - maybe better.     Salud,   JCR/

Figured Judy must be up to something way out - he's had no by-line in his Ala. paper for several

weeks - he should be thru the Paul Bunyan thing by now - can't beat a dead horse, or a dead Paul
Bunyan forever, or maybe Judy can. I thot Paul Bunyan was good for the 1930s, but not still good
in the 1970s. A little bit of P. Bunyan goes a long way, which Judy should have found out in Oregon.

July 1972

Two old goats -

Loudon County Va -
W. Va, is just up the Mt a whoop & a  holler -
where Appalachian Trail crosses.

postcard
stamp 6c
postmark NORTHERN VIRGINIA 7 FEB 1973  PM

 Jack Conroy, Esq.
 701 Fisk Avenue
 MOBERLY, MISSOURI 65270

in pencil [1973]
along side, drawn blue letters with orange  FAKELORE

 Saw some item in Southern magazine re Welshman MEDOC,

but didn't copy item - legendary explorer, but I gather no more
proof of his existence than for Paul Bunyan, altho MEDOC
is said to have been buried in Alabama - we know the Vikings
were here before Columbus, but who & where was MEDOC?
Judy knows!  Who knows? The Shadow do!        JCR

Jack o'boy: Am a bit hung over, but will take pen in hand and send you a pub article that was sent to
me, plus I was sent article re poke salet (sic) greens. Last year I had 3 messes from back yard. this year
I dont see any and I didnt pull em up - two small plants in neighbor's yard so I may retch [sic] over the
fence and borrow them - why do folks pour water offen [sic] the poke - I just use one water - they pour off
the vitamins & most of the flavor.

 Guess you saw my ANVIL stuff? I sent them a batch of drawings done for Daily NEWS - there should

be some suitable for ANVIL - Jack Miller says may use a drawing in No. 6 - and will also use some of
my comments in Letter to the Editor. No word from Judy - note from Dee Brown, in Memphis - says you
need gills to live in Mississippi Valley now.    Cheers,  Jack II.

May 11, 1973

on side Suppose to visit my brother for a week in Blue Ridge - next week I hope -
photograph of man, and dilapidated building  JUL 73

Jack II
photo by daughter  July 1973 -\in the Alexandria slumps -
my backyard -

Oct. 1, 1973
Jack o'boy o'boy:

 Thot you might want to see review of Fabre's book on Richard Wright - I sent Fabre some

copies. don't suppose he subscribed to Clipping Service? Dee Brown said he depended on his
friends to send reviews and a clipping service sent you the bad reviews along with the good and
he didn't want to pay for reading unfavorable reviews. Dee should down your way - they were
going end of Sep - to look for a spot in the Arkansas Ozarks to live. Didn't you say Vance
Randolph was at Fayetteville? I knew a fellow in service, Billy Martin, from Snow Lake,
Arkansas, but lost track of him years ago -

 Thanks for catalogs re WRITERS in REVOLT - it should appeal to young collitch [sic] crowd,

and could be used in English and Creative Writing classes, don't you agree. Grant Code says he
has seen only one review of his poetry book so far - I told him that local papers seldom review
poetry -    Cheers,  JCR/

Oct. 2, 1973
Jack oboy: I'd like to order a couple copies of that revolting WRITERS in REVOLT - should I
wait until Nov. and send order to Ind. Pub. Group? do contributors receive a free copy or is that
too expensive for Hill & Co? I think the book should sell - where else can you get such a collection
of writers for so little? The book on Richard Wright is $15 00 - worse'n DREAM & the DEAL!

 Sent the catalogs to Univ. of Va. liberry [sic], Alexandria (hand delivered) liberry [sic], and Univ. of

Texas at Austin - they have 2 of my blockprints framed & hung - hung where I don't know.

 I promised my daughter a copy - her has moved to icy hills of Vermont to "build a log cabin and

live in the wilds". a body could freeze to death in that State in October or May. Heard they have
9 mos. winter and 3 months poor sledding.

 Had a nice note from Nikki Giovanni, but in her autobiography she is sure rough on us honkies!
Cheers,  Jack II

That Missouri filmed Huckleberry Finn movie is headed towards Alexandria.

postcard
stamp 6c

Jack Conroy
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

drawing of bearded man with head scarf, letter R.
self-portrait in guerilla kafieah, or kafeiah [sic: keffiyeh]
a friend sent from Beirut. He is an American, but exile
from USA.  Lebanese stamp
[[in pencil [1973]  ]]

in pencil [1973]
Jack o'boy: Thanks for the New letters - flattered to be remembered or mentioned by a Prof. in the Sorbonne - nice
little mag. will you answer letter pliz [sic] from Curt Johnson - I never DID have any underline prints /underline 
from those cuts used in Anvil. Assume Hagglund mounted 'em type-hi and used the orig. linocuts in magazine - yes?
what is New Letters per single copy - $1.50? What is Sorbonne's prof's address -? I might drop him a note.    Jack II.

Just had run off some blockprints of Harpers Ferry -  You want one?   8x11" approx.
card painting of man and woman having drinks

postcard
stamp 8c
postmark POSTAL SERVICE VA [Apr?] 1974

Thanks for papers - they sent me two copies - I can use the

others to good advantage, I hope - Spent rainy and cold week-end
at goat farm near Harpers Ferry - ate too much good country cooking -
was snow and ice on mountain tops - visited Harpers Ferry - a restored
tourist trap, even so it was full of tourists.      Jack II.
at bottom  DEGAS - L'Absinthe. 1876 Musee de l'Impressionnisme, Paris.
Jack Conroy, Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

July 8, '74
Jack o'boy I: Good to hear from you - darter [sic: daughter] still in Arkansas and working
in shoe factory, sick from fumes of dye she uses - hopes to get better job soon. I also had
lousy jobs when I was a kid - worse one was in a cement block place - quit after a week. 
No word from Olafson re DECEMBER - he wanted some illustrations for my article but he
never wrote back and I don't know what to send him. You hear from him? Letter from Jerre 
Mangione - he is working on book about the 1930's -1940's, at McDowell Colony. Says AVON
bringing out book on Writers Project, but at high price. Card from Dee Brown in Canada - visiting
Black feet Indians - Why Indians? How about us Anglo-Saxons? We got lost in the shuffle. Nobody
cares about underline us! /underline We just chillun lost in the wilderness, us is. I want
some body to get up on his hind legs and proclaim underline us /underline white folks did
something for what we got - even if what we got ain't much. we did create it - lousy as it is.  The
blacks didn't produce NOTHING, or except for JAZZ, close to nothing. Malcolm Cowley has
article about Walter SCOTT in Horizon magazine - now THAT seems a waste of writing - who
cares about Walter Scott?!

2

Robin been to Greer's Ferry lake in Ozarks and had wunnerful [sic] week-end - hated to go back to 

"flat, dull Jonesboro" - and I thot [sic] Jonesboro was on hill! Maybe she'll get to Mt. View & FOOLKILLER
farm. No word from FOOLKILLERS ?ather? - sent 'em some stuff plus return postage - article & story, 
both sort of WAY OUT, like WAY OUT, MAN.

 I guess Jerre's book is sort of autobiography of his WRITERS PROJECT days - always wondered why

Floyd Dell didn't do his Memoirs - Huxley did - and Dell is ^(was) more entertaining than Huxley.

 Just ordered: JOE NORTH'S: NEW MASSES anthology of the 1930s and MIKE GOLD: A Literary

Anthology, from Washington's Community Bookshop - which translate to R.A.D.I.C.A.L. bookshop -
head shop, poster shop, movement (?) shop, et cet. Can't afford the above, but must have - re-live the
GOOD OLD DAYS of the 1930s - our Golden Age of poverty and revolt. Now all we have is: REVOLTING -

  Yr obdtd [sic] servint [sic]    Jack II

Been 95 [degrees] here - awful - plus air pollution.
in blue ink on side Read Memoir by Malcolm Muggeridge - pompous ole ass I think - worse'n the Sitwells1

Barn on Zabriskie's goat farm -

right: bunch of Jerusalem artichokes they'll harvest in fall.

I got some pumpkin & squash in their garden.

stamped HENRYS Camera Exchange
722 King St.
Alexandria Virg[inia]

envelope
postmark U.S.POSTAL SERVICE VA 220  9 JUL 1974  PM
drawing of barn, mailbox, letter R
John C. Rogers
115 East Maple Street
Alexandria, Virginia 22301
Jack Conroy, Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

Dee Brown has new book out : THE WESTERNERS - Sally will try to get me a copy, but he is only given

SIX and his relatives get most of those -

 I've misplaced my $70 pair of glasses, can't find 'em anywhere - Stupid me, in my dotage or something.

Found em beside the phone, only place I never looked. Old age done got m e. Had letter from John Ackerson -
said he saw letter of yrs in Peoples World or Daily world - or some such.

postcard
stamp 8c
postmark NORTH GARDEN VA 22359 SEP 18 1974  PM

North Garden, Va.


Mr & Mrs. Jack Conroy
701 Fisk Ave.
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

drawing of  bare footed man, fence, mountains  Sad Sack as a Civilian  R

 Back to my brother's place in Blue Ridge -  like the good ol' Depression

days of the 30s - remember those days - almost the same now only they
call it merely inflation. You think there is any hope? Don't say it...
Trees turning here - might could be so in the Ozarks?   Jack II
photo of dirt road and trees

Country roads, country roads...
 in the Blue Ridge Mts.
 North Garden, Va.  9/74.
photo of man with book, trees

At the back of the late Dave Pugh's home at Israels Gap, Va. A
ruined cabin in the Blue Ridge -

 Jack Rogers - 9. 1974

Dave Pugh was small farmer, & moonshiner - he made good likker, he did.

in pencil [197?]
Sunday, Nov.
Jack oboy oboy:

 What happened to underline Foolkiller /underline - supposed to be out in October? Still feudin' among the editors?

Judy Rayford said he offered to go there for underline FREE /underline and they said to wait until spring - he got
another job for that Welsh somebody - who was supposed to have discovered Mobile in early days - a frand [sic] I believe
you said - anyway he is getting paid for his frand [sic] or what-not, Some Welshman, I disremember his name, I think you
said the guy was considered a fake, by historians - Judy seems to thrive on historical fakes - he makes money out of it - 
no hoo, My darter [sic] still at Arkansas and seems to like it -

Robin Elaine Rogers
Box 97

Arkansas State University

JONESBORO, Arkansas 72467

- she'd like to hear from you - she would, She seems to like Arkansas - She's working in Printing Plants -
aside from University -        Jack II,   Stoned

in pencil [1974]
Cheusday [sic] 23 Dec.
Jack oboy oboy:

 Is Santa going to stop by Missouri this year, or will he skip the Conroy's like the

Rogers? Well, he just might - or he might stop by and leave you - all something!

 Us got a cab driver who gives out with the tracts, only more so - as you can see by

the enclosed. He's a red-haired fellow who should be driving a plow - but nice enough
if you don't mind him giving out tracts with a taxi ride, especially when you are laden 
with groceries.
drawing of man with hat, long nose, mitten, grocery bag; TAXI  R.

Oh, well, some of these days -     Jack II

in pencil [1974]
Thursday -

 Jackoboyoboy: Complied & sending Xerox's - I dont want a copy - am not mentioned so no point in keeping

copy - right? Remember Hugh Hanley well from R. P. days - Guess old HH Lewis done cashed he checks - he did
some entertaining poetry I think - and I did some kivers [sic: covers] for him: ROAD TO UTERLY, THINKING OF
RUSSIA - those were sort of good old days weren't they - looking back - everbody [sic] poor and making it out together -
WPA, IWO, IWW, WA, WIR, ILD - you and I stuck with 'em altho [sic] I was suspended for 5 yrs. from guvmint [sic] job -
never found out who turned me in - probably Jay du Von, or local Legionaire?! Luckily I was no card-carryin' 
commun-eest -[sic] - the Communists said I was too much of an individualist! at ^least one Party gal told me that -
still, I did "conform" 41 mos. in the Air force, and local heart dr. says army had no business drafting e! The Gov't
never really forgave me for telling an Investigator if I had my life to live over I would live the same life - Sometimes
I feel I don't have fur [sic] to go to cash in my checks - just plumb wore out. Sorry re FOOLKILLER. I don't have
no luck lately with publishing - darter [sic] still with ASU at Jonesboro - seems to have found a second home. I
think I too, wld [sic] like Arkansas.   (over)

Judy requested Xerox of She Keeps a Dairy - says it is great American humor - wish ^some publishers 

thot [sic] so. Judy says he offered to help FOOLKILLER out for free & they turned him down - said to 
wait until Spring. Getting cold here - in 30's - real cold weather slows me down - don't breathe so good.
How's Gladys - remember her from that big apartment you had in Chicago - and conductor warning me
to stay in the light because of the hoods - and you said the hoods didn't bother you - liked Chicago - never
liked New York - New Yorkers are not of this world, or any other.

 Sorry about Beu Botkin - he did some good work and he never turned his back on radicals - I never heard

from any letter I wrote him - you'd think his children would answer? or his wife. I'm just a Goy so I guess 
Jews dont feel I deserve an answer. They never put Mike Gold's paperback in Alexandria Library - oh
little Mike we need a great American revolution, then your stories will be in the Alexandria Library along
with Paine, & Jefferson, and Ben Field (he is there) - oh little Mike you will be honored. I promise it.

 Jack II.

in pencil  [1975]
Monday, Feb. 3,

 Jack oboy oboy: don't know if I ever sent you this one. Sending it anyhoo - good memories you know.

Like to have CCC now - am a bit over-age I guess. Went to doctor Friday a.m. - had some tests and
have to wait until tomorrow to find out if I am on the level - they took some blood and will test it
three ways to see how I am doing.

 Got to watch old cholesterol I tell you - ha - ha - he gives me pills to take and I ignore them - got

something better to do until old cholesterol get me down - oh oh, take those pills then, you stupid
ox - yes suh [sic], massa [sic] I saw the regimen coming just like you said. never no time like the present.

 Son Jeff's gal friend had an abortion - said she didnt want to git [sic] married and have an unnatural baby,

no how. Her mom has been pestering her since - She is running out to Norfolk, Va. for a year's rest from
her momma. I'm glad I never had no trouble with the law for nothin' [sic] - I had trouble but it was all
legal and above board. Well, here's looking at yuh [sic], and such.      Jack II.

drawing by John C. Rogers - house, barn, trees, farm field
John C. Rogers Oct 1950

postcard
stamp 8c
postmark U.S. POSTAL SERVICE. VA 229  MAR 1975  PM

Library doesn't subscribe to Amer. Libraries - gets them by courtesy

of another Librarian - evidently didn't supply Dec. issue - gal says
she will try and get it for me, so don't send until you hear from me.
Sounds like a good chapter in DECEMBER - No, Ford don't allow
no Art PROjects PRO underlined playin' here, he don't and won't. 
Mangione shld [sic] have known THAT! Maybe he did.  I do.   Jack II.
Mr Jack Conroy
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

postcard
postmark NORTH GAR  JUL 10 1975
CHV - 1 "CORNER" CHARLOTTESVILLE, VIRGINIA
The amiable atmosphere of Charlottesville and the University is
nowhere better exemplified than on the "Corner." since 1948 Miner's
Pipe Shop has been the "heart of the Corner." Books, records, college
supplies, and underline interesting conversation are all available.
/underline   Photo by MASUR

 Now if we only had the Oracle of Moberly! Hot as blue blazes here

and rain - rain go away, come again on washin' [sic] day - but us doesn't
mind.   JCR.
Mr. & Mrs. Jack Conroy
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri

postcard
stamp 8c
postmark HARPERS FERRY WV AUG 18 1975  PM

 Jack Conroy, Esq.
 741 Fisk Avenue
 MOBERLY, Missouri

Well, you all stalled again?

Up in ole John Brown's Country.

Reckon I kin git [sic] out?

 Jack II.

drawing of man in shorts

in pencil John Rogers
Aug. 4 or 5 or thereabout.
Jack oboy oboy:

 Here's a little item you suggested I return after digesting. I digested the gem and am highly edified

to know such a person - especially since I met you and wife and sister in Chicago during those dark
dismal days when it looked like all was up the crick for us. and without a paddle.

 seems like Writers in Revolt might of been pushed a little harder, but them Jews in New York would

push a little harder back and there would be no end to it - ah me?, seems a pity too. Did I tell you -
I got Norman Poderhetz book but couldnt stand it - put it back on shelf after perusing it for awhile -
I find I have little sympathy for such goings on - I am of course anti-Zionist, and anti-Semitic if that
goes with the anti-Zionist - I would like to see Israel plowed into the sea - it has been nothing but a
nest of vipers since its inception - as England and the USA knew! Oh me, leave us have a war about it.

  Jack II.

Nov. 2, 1975
Jack oboy oboy:

 I hope your sister doesn't suffer too much with that terminal cancer - my wife suffered too much -

too much for modern medicine to condone - but I am not a good judge. I met one of your sisters in
Chicago didn't I?

 Will try to answer that creep Leahy - if I can - I hope they print your answer to him -

they seem to have space for such-witness the space taken up for the early tools?!

 Our letters must have crossed - mail service what it is - no big difference - no sweat off no one's

back. Have time on my hands - nothing to do - nothing to gain - hoo-ee - should be writing 
underline my /underline memoirs, my daughter says - and she is mighty smart I think. Have idea
of a short piece about Sacco-Vanzetti murder - we distributed leaflets in Washington on the night of their
murder - might get the FBI crawling around me if I do - but I guess they have forgot all that. I haven't
forgot - nor will I. Cheers, if any.     Jack II.

envelope
stamps 10c 10c
postmark U.S. POSTAL SERVICE VA. 2 NOV 1975
Mr. John C. Rogers
115 E Maple Street
Alexandria, Va. 22301
drawing of man with shotgun   R.
Jack Conroy, Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

29 Nov. 1975
Jack oboy oboy:

 Well, I got something agin [sic] those old Zionists - I did, even tho' they cut out a paragraph about making it another Viet Nam.

Be thankful of small favors, oh little son.

 My son, his wife (common law), and a black friend just got ordered out of a local shop owned by some Vietnamese - they got

most of their order, but that ^ is about it. Just a few minutes later another fellow said he got thrown out (verbally) - what are we
gonna do with these Johnny - come - lately newcomers to our scene? Here, a few days and they start ordering the native Americans
around - soon as they get Lebensraum they do it - the natives (the young ones) are right shook up over it.

 I have lived too long with like beings to view it with anything but amusement.      Jack II.

drawing of man and another man.  R.   You git outa [sic] my store, I don't need your patronage -
Aw sheet [sic]

stamp 7c

Jack Conroy, Esq. Patriot
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

drawing of man's head in circle; J.C.R. Patriot  U.S. Postage 1c

Whoops for the Revolution - the  Bicentteniel [sic] fracas I mean. M.E. writes from

New Orleans he has put two copies of his new book aside with our names on it -
out this coming Spring, hopefully. what are YOU doing for the Bicentennial? What
is Missouri doing? You should see the so-called Second Hand shops opening up -
Yuk Yuk Yuk!   Yrs for Revolution!

in pencil [1975]

John C. Rogers

Jack Conroy, Esq.

photo of shelf with some books by Jack Conroy, including the Disinherited, Writers in Revolt; 2 pictures on wall

Some of the world's Great Books above - that's the famous photo of Ernie Pyle on upper right -

a rare print, since I think photographer is not with us anymore - sorry I left out Das Kapital, Mein
Kampf, and Ezra Pound - I don't like DULL writers, even good ones.

[[in pencil] [1975]
Jackoboy: Why couldn't the underline FOOLKILLER /underline be a underline Quarterly? /underline
Surely Kansas City could support a Quarterly - and THAT could be better than no underline FOOLKILLER?! /underline

Wouldn't it - and it might be for a better underline FOOLKILLER, /underline Why not? did the Foolkillers think of such

a thing? A underline Quarterly /underline seems like a good deal.  Got time to arrange good material and time to get
money for publication - like using underline local ads /underline for money? The underline Foolkiller /underline
could be a natural for local ads - might even get a few underline national beer or whiskey ads /underline - and still not
change policy - a half -page ad from a brewery or liquor company would pay for publication. did they think of it? I think of it.
Get to it.    Jack II.

in pencil [1975]
Jack oboy oboy: Alexandria Liberry [sic] didnt get the Christmas issue of American Libraries - so I got two alternatives -
only two - go to Fairfax - they have a copy; Copies not allowed out of the libraries - I don't know where the libraries are,
assume they are on bus lines. Will check and make plans to sneak up on American Libraries - get a strangle hold on same
and read 'em afore you can say Jack Robinson. You have any other alternative plan? That's the best us'ns can do - not having
no copy of the fetched magazine.

 Us has a new cat here - named Primo. A 5-month old Persian - smart as a whip - bops our 5-year old Syd all over the place -

Syd won't play - wop, he gets banged agin [sic] the floor - weight of the Persian must bowls him over - time and again - he never
learns - 5 years on the roots and now he gets socked off it. so be it.    Jack II.

John C. Rogers
115 East Maple Street
Alexandria, Virginia 22301
drawing of outhouse, man's face, pig's face, R.  COUSIN CHARLIE!  OINK
Hon. Jack Conroy
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

Jan.8, 1976
Jack oboy oboy:

 Sending along an enlargement I had made - of Cottage Grove Ave. if I remember right? and you

looking big as life. Thought you might could use it - I like it - the mass of that building looming
in the background and the blacks - seems like I remember Chicago - the conductor on the streetcar
warning me about not traveling in the shadows and you telling e never had any trouble in the area -
I never had any trouble either - maybe it was the uniform. But I never had any trouble anywhere -
so that let's me out. Far as trouble goes.

 Well, here is your enlargement. I like it. Another thing I'd like about underline six /underline

copies of the DECEMBER magazine - consider I'd get a contributors copy and have to pay for the
rest - how much should I send Curt Johnson - I don't know the cost of magazine and I'd like to pay a
reasonable price - $1.00 per issue or more?     Yours in Christ Jesus for the Revolution,

   Jack II/

115 E Maple Str.
Alexandria, Va. 22301

 --in pencil]] Rogers

in pencil Rogers, John C.

Jan. 24, 1976

Jackoboy I:

 So old Ben has bit the dust - Just had a note from Nancy Ackerson - her pop. John T. has gone also - 

cancer of the prostate & bladder - Nancy didn't give date, but assume it must have been recent - like
October or November. Her address:  Mrs. Nancy Kowalchuck, 665 Rose Drive, PARAMUS, New Jersey, 07652

Sorry to hear about your sister - crossed out daughter - my wife died of cancer - its an awful disease and

I have sympathy for anyone who has it, but sympathy doesn't do no good - I know.

 So old H.H. Lewis is still kicking?! I don't blame you from being scared - I would be too - Lemme [sic] know

how it goes - if student gets a scoop, or whatever he is after. Seems like old HHL is the same, or more so.

 Will hold up, if I can, on DECEMBER - April is not too long to wait, since we didn't expect THAT, did we?

Johnson received two photos from U. of Va., plus two drawings - underline what /underline he's gonna
do with all that is anybody's guess. I'm just a-waiting - Who -ee -ee!      Carry on,  Jack II

10 April 1976
Jackoboy oboy:

 Yeh, our post office has a handsome xerox which is like yours - only works sometimes - thanks for

the underline Hinterland /underline. I remember it now, altho I didn't recall the Great Cornhusking
Derby and the place you and Hagglund had - it was a grand piece and does HHL a lot of good - if he can
write like that now he should have it made. If any of us have it made.

 Your quote of Poe was apt - I watched my wife die slowly of cancer - it is not a pleasant disease to watch -

the Unitarian Minister read from Swinburne's " - from too much love of living, from hope and fear set free" -
the Minister was later murdered on a Civil rights March in Alabama - no one was ever punished?1

 Will send your underline HINTERLAND /underline back soon as I xerox it, iffen the Xeroxer is working.
 was all set to trot down to MOBILE and see Rayford - until doctor told me my heart was not beating on all beats -

the Dr. thought the trip would do me good, but not me - I'm sitting home until the beats get somewhat together.
Would rather go to new Orleans, but NO ANSWER to my letter to M. Edmunds - another one conked out?!
I gave the money back to darter [sic] Robin - she can use it at the Univ.

 Ah me, it is but to dream.   Salud,    Jack II     in pencil  Rogers

typed   -2-
as we do have to work underline together /underline if we are to turn the tide that would engulf us all.

 I am grateful for your consideration. I hope you will come forward with as generous a contribution as

possible, and I ask for your prayers too in the difficult months ahead.

  Sincerely,

[signature] Jim Buckley  brown ink  HIS signature?
James L. Buckley   U.S. Senator
P.S. The early stages of underline any /underline campaign are the most vital: $100 now can be worth many times
that later (at today's costs, we must hope for an underline average /underline of at least $25 from each person to
meet our immediate needs.) /typed    brown ink !!

 How did these misfits get underline MY /underline name for their roster? Looks like the ultra-right is going after

the left-wingers in a big way. I guess maybe they figure if you can't beat 'em join 'em.

 I was going to visit Judy and got set back by my doctor observing my ticker wasn't ticking right, so I put it off, altho it

would be good to get away for awhile. Maybe next time - if there is any next time. I have a date with the Clinic - NIH -
next month - will see what THEY  say. They're inclined to be more liberal with their opinions than the local doctor.

 Sorry to hear about your Sister - I just read "The Verdict" by Hildegarde Kneff - rather morbid - not up to her's "The

Horses Mouth". She's an unrepenting Nazi, as I read her. But worth reading anyhoo.

on side  warming up now - after freezing us and killing most of the crops. Not living right I guess.

page full of little drawings, with captions - by John Rogers
Man standing in front of round spool table with glass. Bottle of Heineken beer on table. I'm GLAD We Got Heineken!      CARTER WALLACE FORD ANYBODY
Man, another man leaning over a barrel, another man with glass  THEY'RE ALL EMPTY     AIN'T NOTHIN' IN HERE!      TRY THIS ONE -
Man with raised arms, letter R.,  duck  GIVE UP FOLKS - THE SHOWS OVER - JUST LIKE LAST TIME!     WANNA BUY A DUCK?

in pencil Midwest MS Conroy
Rogers, John C. (Jack)
May 2, 1976

 Best wishes -
  Jack oboy oboy!

Mr. Jack Conroy

701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

in pencil Rogers, John C.
drawing of man waving; 6 flags

 SIX flags over Mid-America.

H'lo Flags! I salute you Not in a
subservient sense, but just because you were there.
Hope things are better now than they were in the
past, but I very much doubt it. No never rec'd FOOLKILLER -
never rec'd nothing! Never expect to receive nothing1

Not ever disappointed.    JCR.

7 May 1976
Jack oboy oboy:

 Have COLOR duplicating in the liberry [sic] now -got a little off on the Blue, but I figure it is purty [sic]

good for first time?! Will improve with age I reckon.

 No word from Johnson and Nash them two absent writers? Sorry your colyam [sic] got mixed up in the 

FOOLKILLER - they had a colyum [sic] of mine but guess it thrown out with the wash - that's a joke and don't
you forgit [sic] it. Like your talking on "The Relief Client as Folk Villain" - the Relief Client is just THAT
isn't he - at least in most localities I gather he is.  Or are you making a joke of the situation?

 Too bad about your COLLECTED WORKS - nothing good seems to be accomplished does it?
 I guess they didn't have the Six Flags bit when I went thru St. Louis in '43 did they? They had a good old German

restaurant near the Union Station, where I fed and wined myself, right passable place it were. Ah me, you get old
you recall all those old spots.

 Sorry I didn't get to see Judy - a bit difficult to get there anyhoo.     86's, and then some       Jack II.

on side Little girl in a bar the other day dragged an American flag through the dirt and an old Colonel, a regular, had
a fit - most of the regulars laughed it off, as did Jolly Roger, whose sympathy was with the little tot. Aren't we all.

13 June 1976
Jack oboy oboy:

 Summer has come a setting down with all its heat, humidity and corruption of air.
 All you can do to walk down the street, and I do walk  down the street to visit the

library and buy some groceries.'  Enclosed Flag Worship was give to me by an 84 or 85
year old lady who clerks in a grocery store. She recently had an operation for something 
or other, and is a mighty fine ole gal. I don't take the flag worship seriously - she comes
by it naturally, from the Page Valley in Virginia, home of moonshiners and an old time
German band. I know it well: haunts of hants, little people and varmints.

 No word from them two traveling idjits [sic], what have taken two years to visit your

place? No word of that there magazine with the Morphydite story? No word about
nothing? Might as well close up shop.     Cheers,   Jack II

115 E Maple St. Alex. Va. 22301

Aug 5, 1976
Jack oboy oboy:

 Watchman, what of DECEMBER?   Edgar Rice Burroughs wrote of Mars before VIKING landed -

ah me, I used to lap the Burroughs' books up.

 Last time I saw Nelson A. Algren was on TV - he was on the downgrade then as I recall - looked like a

skidrow bum he did.

 I never been at, or near "the Susquehanna Valley" - you have promoted a wrong one.   That Nash is a rale

one - I can't even do a short story and hear he is a writing corporation, should be Nash, Inc.

 Don't think I have anything to hand for that TRA [the R is backwards] - you ever seen a copy?
 Like to visit Mountain View - daughter is no longer in Arkansas - in Blacksburg, Va. working for a

newspaper, writing and taking pictures. Like daughter, like poppa. she aims to go to the University of
Virginia, if she ever gets accepted.

 You are right about the GOP candidates - ole grit eating Carter is less harmful I believe, but we gets

sorrier and sorrier I do believe.       Hanging in there, don't know anything else to do,      Jack II.

I'll send TRA [R is backwards] to Lindenschmidt - maybe it will stir him UP.
 in pencil   Rogers

postcard
stamp  9c
postmark Northern Virginia, VA 220  1 Sept 1976  PM
printed  Morris Hirshfield  Katzen im Gras - Cat and Kitten on Grass
drawing of man throwing dart at dartboard
on side  Gus Katz had six Katzen, not on grass - gave 'em all
away to good homes (we hope). We can but wait and hope that DECEMBER
does appear in 2 months -  they DID get to MOBERLY!!     Jack II.
X circled Love that X where you didn't.
Hon. Jack Conroy
Sage of MOBERLY
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

7 Sept. 1976
Dear Jack oboy oboy:

 Don't know nothing about this hyeah [sic] puppet theater, 'cept [sic] I seen them carting stuff out of the

building and putting stuff into the building. Last time I recall a movie in the place was the "Garden of the
Conti Continis" or sumpun [sic] - I saw the movie on TV - thought you might know something about the
students from Lindenwood College of Missouri, working for their apprenticeship or whatever. I may take
in a show if it looks likely. They spoke of the Old Heidelberg Rathskeller in the write-up and the Old
Heidelberg has an original watercolor hanging by the ladies and mens johns, by John C. Rogers - formerly
artist in-residence of the place, afore I come a-croppin' of hard liquor and used to frequent the place. Now,
alas, it is few and between times when I get by the place. I used to favor dark German beer and bourbon in
my time, but no more, not no more.

 How's things in Missouri, and anent? the Quarterly underline Foolkiller [/underline]] ? Haven't heard

from them for a month o' Sundays - guess they give me up as a furrin' [sic] kind of man.

 Hanging in there,     Jack II.

postcard 
stamp 9c
postmark NORTHERN VIRGINIA, VA. 220  [2]2 SEP 1976
printed  Visitors from every country enjoy this choice view of the East Front
of George Washington's Home, Mount Vernon. The majestic panoramic prospect
of the Potomac River and the Maryland countryside is world famous.
on side   Weel, we'll just have to hang in there until the
good things start a-drappin [sic]. Can't rush them none, us can't.

Hangin' in there.

22 Sep. '76     Jack II.
Jack Conroy, Esq.
701 Fisk Avenue
MOBERLY, Missouri 65270

Oct. 3, 1976
Jack oboy oboy:

 Who has me on a Conservative Mailing List? I get stuff from Bill Buckley, Adm. Zumwalt and now this bit of crap from

the Christian side of the unholy fence. It makes you to wonder, it does indeed. I can take it, grinning all the while. Now,
we had that Moonie in the area - that moon-faced millionaire from Korea - how does HE expect to capture the unmoonfaced
WHITE Christians with his spiel and him an Oriental to boot - to boot is to hoot - hoot mon, and away with him and his
moon-faced Christianity and why? I wrote a letter - to - the - editor, never published - questioning this moon-faced fascist from
Korea - how come newspapers never print my letters? I guess I tell the truth and the truth hurts, doesn't it? Well,  you can only
keep trying and maybe some day you will see print.

 When I get my tap-writer [sic] replaced I will make things hum - hum hum hum. You take care, and I'll take care, and we don't

have a care in the world.     Bubble hush, as my Irish friend used to say,   Jack II.
on side  My son, and his Valerie have went to a Blue Grass Festival, to smoke some pot, I reckon, and left me minding the
store and the cats.

Nov. 14. 1976

Dear Jack:
  Finally received the FOOLKILLER - liked the H.H. Lewis piece and yours about old Tom Benton,

the reprint of Butz's remarks and poem or song about Patty Hearst. Read what they said about I would
be in next and recall I'd sent them that piece in underline The NEWS /underline about the Army
making me an official artist - told them I guess the NEWS wouldn't mind a reprint provided they got
credit - well it was an entertaining piece - I sent it to you didn't I? If not you can read it all in the
FOOLKILLER - I guess they can use the drawings since it is offset. Do you think H.H. Lewis would
answer if I wrote him a note - didn't realize he was that old - he stopped by and stayed overnight in
Virginia with me I think - was good company and got along with my Mom and Pop - at least I think
it was Lewis, I know Boris Israel was by - Hard to remember, got no memory to speak of anymore.

 Hanging on,  Jack II.

on side How to get that paperback about Benton - I have a sketch by Joe Jones - only a linocut
he did for ANVIL - had a letter from him but don't have it now. Remember?

in pencil Rogers, Jack

27 Nov. 1976

Jack oboy oboy:

 Sent letter to H.H. Lewis, the cowflop poet of the Gumbo - didn't realize he was that old, but

I'm almost 70 so who am I to talk?! Yes, I thot [sic] the Patty Hearst pome [sic] was Okeh as
well as the piece about Lewis. Liked yours about old Benton - he was a great one, he was altho I
might not agree with ALL of his art, he did a fine job. Received underline five /underline
(5) FOOLKILLERS in one mailing - have to figure five persons worthy to receive it - all my
friends are dying off - A scary feeling - I may be next.

 Like summer today - 75º - and the other day it was nearer 20º ?! Still have my long-johns on.
Rather sweat than freeze.
 Sent some samples of my writing to MODERN MATURITY and got a form-printed Rejection -

they evidently didn't even read the stuff - want to keep the Retirees alike as two peas - phooie.
Ought to have a Radical group of Retirees, say you not so? Run the AARP like the American
Legion, they do.

 Dee Brown griping because they picked Saul Bellow for Nobel Prize - says we must be becoming

illiterate country - So we must.       Salud!  Jack II.
on side Saw a letter in the press signed by Bellow, Mailer etc. wanted to answer it but didn't.
Bunch of comedians, as you once wrote.

envelope
stamp 13c
drawing of man with pen

 Hon. Jack Conroy, Sage of Moberly
 701 Fisk Avenue
 MOBERLY, Missouri  65270

in pencil Rogers, John C.

 14 Dec 1976

Jack oboy oboy:

 Season's greetings and stuff and stuffings.
 Judy called me Friday evening - out of hospital he said, wished me a good Holiday,

said he was trying to get the Welsh ceremony off the ground. Late Grant Code said Judy wanted a
Welsh parade in New York - Grant told Judy there were "too many parades in New York." and to
forget. Grant also said Madoc was a myth - never was such an explorer. You know Judy - we all
know Judy - make a silk purse out of cow's ear given the chance. Have Paul Bunyan as President 
of Virginia beef eaters or sumpin'. [sic]

 Think I broke three more ribs - feel like it. Just grin and bear it - can't go to doc with THAT again!?!
 Wrote to Beyond Baroque Foundation - did I tell you Thanks for info. No typewriter yet.
    !Salud!    Jack II.

on side  Berkeley Jr. at Univ. of Va. think you have a paragraph missing from your estimable
article - from end of page one to beginning of Page 9? Do you?

in pencil Rogers, John C.

Jack oboy oboy:
 No Christmas to speak ^of - drank too much and fell down and cracked my head open - feel like I knocked some

ribs loose, probably did. Have to see the Doctor tomorrow - oh, me, oh my. Card from Lindenschmidt - he is 73!
I had no idea he was old as underline that /underline - feeling his age, he says. Feeling my age too - just
every now and then I get to feeling my age - just like that - everybody says oh you're getting older and don't know
it - that's it, I'm getting older but underline I /underline don't know it. Hang in there, Jack, hang in there -
it's going to be a grand day on the morrow. Well I'm hanging in there just to see what the morrows bring. Remember
these oldies of the Art Institute? and that old beer sign I took in Oklahoma? 10 cents a mug? Sixty cents to a dollar a
mug around here - and not a large mug like the one in picture. I get MOLSON'S ALE (Canada) from the A & P, and
that slakes my thirst. Had a nice note from Ol^afson, got him a deal running an apartment not far from where Lindy
lives - hope they can get together - Olafson's address: 123 Lakeshore Drive, Lake Elsinore, CA 92330 - he sent me
a postcard pitcher [sic] of the place. Thank goodness it is a bit like winter now - first time in 10 years according to
weather experts. I like it. All we need is a snow. small drawing of 3 heads    Thanks for card.      Jack II.
on side SEASON'S GREETINGS  John C. Rogers 115 East Maple Street Alexandria, Va. 22301

FOOLKILLER rec'd - you and ole Utah take the cake - keep
